channel.title: [508] Adding auto trim for 2 or more 99 skills
channel.description:
How do I add this? I saw a topic on r-s but I don't have a client.java file. Is that usual for a 508 or is it just the source I have??
If there's nothing wrong with not having client.java someone please tell me how to do this because I searched on here and i'm pretty sure there's not a tut.

item.title: [508] Adding auto trim for 2 or more 99 skills
item.dc:creator: @joshisfamous joshisfamous
item.description:
@joshisfamous wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:8, topic:447165”]Well you just wasted a bunch of time, because 508’s don’t have a client.java

508’s are what we call packaged, in that the classes are more split up instead of all in one giant ‘client.java’ file.[/quote]

Lol thanks thats what I thought

OT: But do you know how to add the auto trimmed skillcapes for 2 or more 99s?

Edit: Come on people I know someone knows how to do this or at least have the method I can add by myself please.

Read full topic
item.source: [508] Adding auto trim for 2 or more 99 skills

item.title: [508] Adding auto trim for 2 or more 99 skills
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Well you just wasted a bunch of time, because 508’s don’t have a client.java

508’s are what we call packaged, in that the classes are more split up instead of all in one giant ‘client.java’ file.

item.title: [508] Adding auto trim for 2 or more 99 skills
item.dc:creator: @joshisfamous joshisfamous
item.description:
@joshisfamous wrote:

[quote=“i am infamy, post:6, topic:447165”]1.
Open Folder Options in Control Panel.
•
Click Start, and then click Control Panel.
•
Click Appearance and Themes, and then click Folder Options.
2.
On the View tab, under Hidden files and folders, click Show hidden files and folders.[/quote]

It was already selected.

Read full topic
item.source: [508] Adding auto trim for 2 or more 99 skills

item.title: [508] Adding auto trim for 2 or more 99 skills
item.dc:creator: @i_am_infamy i am infamy
item.description:
@i_am_infamy wrote:

Open Folder Options in Control Panel.
•
Click Start, and then click Control Panel.
•
Click Appearance and Themes, and then click Folder Options.
2.
On the View tab, under Hidden files and folders, click Show hidden files and folders.

Read full topic
item.source: [508] Adding auto trim for 2 or more 99 skills

item.title: [508] Adding auto trim for 2 or more 99 skills
item.dc:creator: @joshisfamous joshisfamous
item.description:
@joshisfamous wrote:

[quote=“i am infamy, post:4, topic:447165”]If your on window’s 7 go to the top left of your folder click

Organize> Folder and search options>View

and tick the “show hidden files, Folders, and drives”[/quote]

I’m using Windows Xp

Read full topic
